soundings series

May 30
2014

Soundings - Sam Roxas-Chua tomorrow!

Sam Roderick Roxas-Chua grew up in Glendale, California. Sam has read for Oregon Poetry Association and the Windfall Reading Series. He is currently published by The Inflectionist Review and Open2Interpretation. His first collection of poems is titled “Fawn Language” published by Tebot Bach of Huntington Beach, CA. He is a member of Red Sofa Poetry Critique Group and Centrum’s Madrona Writers Group in Port Townsend, WA. Sam lives in Eugene, Oregon and is a student at Pacific University’s MFA in Writing program. Find out more about Sam at The Poetry Loft -www.thepoetryloft.net/samroxaschua/ & www.samroderick.com

Join us, Sam, and a ton of our friends at Ford Food + Drink at 7pm tomorrow! See you there!

  • May 30, 2014
May 30
2014

Join us at Soundings for a preformance by The OO-Ray.

Ford Food + Drink 7pm

The OO-Ray is the alias of Ted Laderas, an improvisatory and experimental cellist from Portland, OR. A systems biologist by day, he extends his experimental attitude to exploring the outer possibilities of the cello, often distorting, looping, or pitchshifting his instrument beyond recognizability into waves of reverberation and extended drones. Inspired by the gauzy textures of My Bloody Valentine, he call his style “shoegazer cello” or “chamber drone”. His music explores the realms of electroacoustic, shoegazer, and ambient.

May 29

This Saturday: Amy Temple Harper

Join us this Saturday for the first Soundings! 7pm @ Ford Food + Drink 

Amy Temple Harper was born in Korea and is the author of “Cramped Uptown” by Spork Press. Her poetry has been published by The Oregon Literary Review, Portland Review, and Nailed Magazine. She is a teacher and a mother.

May 28
2014

Featured at Soundings: Emily Newberry

Emily Pittman Newberry is a performance poet living in Portland, Oregon. She is fascinated by the way we dance with vulnerability as our lives intersect, and by how the rich diversity of life and the many paths we take somehow seem to lead us all home. 

OneSpirit Press published her two books of poetry, Butterfly A Rose and Nature Speaking, Naturally, a collaboration with artist Adelaide Beeman-White. In addition the artist book featuring her poetry and the work of Portland artist Shu-Ju Wang comes out this May. Her website iswww.wizense.com.

Please join us, Emily, and our amazing friends this Saturday at 7pm with the folks at Ford Food + Drink

May 28

This Saturday: Jeff Whitney

Please join us this Saturday at 7pm with the fine folks at Ford Food + Drink!

Jeff Whitney is one of the fantastic poets reading at Soundings!

Jeff Whitney is a co-founding editor of Peel Press and the author of two chapbooks. Recent poems can be found in burntdistrict, Devil’s Lake, Salt Hill, and Verse Daily. He teaches English as a second language in Portland.

May 06
2014

what we are all about…

Soundings is a series created by two people, like-minded in their approach to loving language and music. Aaron Schuman and Juleen Johnson wanted to find a way to bring their passions together, creating a place in which two communities - music and writing - find common ground in their pursuits. In this endeavor, both advocate for the idea that language and music can coexist in the same space, learning and growing from interaction with each other. With this in mind, we hope this gathering helps bridge the gap between two similar yet distinct artforms.

Thank you.

Juleen Johnson and Aaron Schuman
